phlp.name: PhIP (2-Amino-1-methyl-6-phenylimidazo[4,5-b]pyridine)
phlp.why_avoid: Potent mutagen formed when meat is cooked at high temperatures

phthalates.name: Phthalates
phthalates.description: Plasticizers that migrate from food packaging
phthalates.health_effects: Endocrine disruption, reproductive and developmental toxicity

plastics.name: Plastic Additives
plastics.description: Various chemicals from plastic food packaging
plastics.why_avoid: Chemical migration from packaging into food

polyamides.name: Polyamides
polyamides.description: Synthetic polymers used in food packaging
polyamides.why_avoid: May release chemical additives into food

polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons.name: Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons
polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons.description: Carcinogenic compounds formed during grilling and smoking

polyfluoroalkyl.name: Polyfluoroalkyl Substances
polyfluoroalkyl.why_avoid: Forever chemicals with serious health impacts

polymeric.name: Polymeric Additives
polymeric.description: Large molecule additives in food processing
polymeric.health_effects: Potential breakdown into smaller toxic compounds
polymeric.why_avoid: May degrade into harmful smaller molecules

polyolefins.name: Polyolefins
polyolefins.description: Plastic materials used in food packaging
polyolefins.health_effects: Potential migration of additives and monomers

polysorbate 60.name: Polysorbate 60
polysorbate 60.health_effects: May disrupt gut bacteria and cause digestive issues
polysorbate 60.why_avoid: Synthetic emulsifier that may affect gut health

polystyrene.name: Polystyrene
polystyrene.description: Plastic material used in food containers
polystyrene.why_avoid: Styrene is a possible human carcinogen

potasium sorbet.name: Potassium Sorbate
potasium sorbet.description: Synthetic preservative to prevent mold growth
potasium sorbet.health_effects: May cause allergic reactions and skin irritation
potasium sorbet.why_avoid: Can trigger allergic responses in sensitive individuals

potassium benzoate.name: Potassium Benzoate
potassium benzoate.description: Chemical preservative similar to sodium benzoate
potassium benzoate.health_effects: May form benzene when combined with vitamin C

potassium bromate.name: Potassium Bromate
potassium bromate.description: Chemical used to strengthen bread dough
potassium bromate.health_effects: Probable human carcinogen, kidney and thyroid toxicity
potassium bromate.why_avoid: Banned in many countries due to cancer risk

prepallants.name: Propellants
prepallants.description: Gases used to dispense food products
prepallants.health_effects: Not intended for consumption, potential respiratory effects
prepallants.why_avoid: Industrial gases not meant for ingestion

propane.name: Propane
propane.description: Propellant gas used in food dispensers
propane.why_avoid: Industrial gas not intended for consumption

propellant.name: Propellant
propellant.description: Gases used to dispense food products from containers
propellant.health_effects: Various depending on specific gas, not intended for consumption
propellant.why_avoid: Industrial chemicals not meant for ingestion

propyl gallate.name: Propyl Gallate
propyl gallate.health_effects: May cause allergic reactions and stomach irritation

propyl paraben.name: Propyl Paraben
propyl paraben.description: Preservative that may migrate from packaging

propylene.name: Propylene
propylene.description: Chemical compound used in food processing
propylene.why_avoid: Industrial chemical with limited safety data

propylene glycol.name: Propylene Glycol
propylene glycol.description: Chemical used as humectant and solvent
propylene glycol.health_effects: May cause allergic reactions and skin irritation
propylene glycol.why_avoid: Industrial chemical used in antifreeze and cosmetics

ptaquiloside.name: Ptaquiloside
ptaquiloside.description: Carcinogenic compound found in bracken fern

pyrethroid.name: Pyrethroid
pyrethroid.description: Synthetic insecticide that may contaminate foods

pyrrolizidine alkaloids.name: Pyrrolizidine Alkaloids
pyrrolizidine alkaloids.description: Natural toxins found in certain plants
pyrrolizidine alkaloids.why_avoid: Highly toxic plant compounds causing organ damage

quinoline yellow.name: Quinoline Yellow
quinoline yellow.health_effects: May cause allergic reactions and hyperactivity
quinoline yellow.why_avoid: Artificial dye linked to behavioral problems

red #3.name: Red #3 (Erythrosine)
red #3.health_effects: May cause thyroid tumors and hyperactivity
red #3.why_avoid: Banned in cosmetics due to cancer concerns

red #40.name: Red #40 (Allura Red)
red #40.health_effects: Linked to hyperactivity in children and allergic reactions
red #40.why_avoid: Made from petroleum derivatives, behavioral effects

red 3.name: Red 3
red 3.why_avoid: Safety concerns led to restrictions in some uses

red 40.name: Red 40
red 40.health_effects: Linked to hyperactivity in children and allergic reactions

red.name: Red (Food Coloring)
red.health_effects: May cause allergic reactions and behavioral issues

retronecine.name: Retronecine
retronecine.description: Pyrrolizidine alkaloid found in certain plants
retronecine.why_avoid: Highly toxic alkaloid causing liver damage

safflower oil.name: Safflower Oil
safflower oil.description: Highly processed oil very high in omega-6 fatty acids
safflower oil.health_effects: Extremely high omega-6 content promotes inflammation
safflower oil.why_avoid: One of the highest omega-6 oils, strongly pro-inflammatory

safrole.name: Safrole
safrole.description: Natural compound found in sassafras and other plants

semicarbazide.name: Semicarbazide
semicarbazide.description: Chemical that forms from azodicarbonamide breakdown
semicarbazide.why_avoid: Forms from banned food additive breakdown

seneciphylline.name: Seneciphylline
seneciphylline.why_avoid: Toxic alkaloid causing severe liver damage

senecionine.name: Senecionine
senecionine.why_avoid: Causes severe liver damage and cancer

silicon dioxide.name: Silicon Dioxide
silicon dioxide.description: Anti-caking agent used in processed foods
silicon dioxide.health_effects: May cause respiratory issues if inhaled, digestive irritation
silicon dioxide.why_avoid: Industrial additive with potential health concerns

sodium acid pyrophosphate.name: Sodium Acid Pyrophosphate
sodium acid pyrophosphate.health_effects: May cause nausea and digestive upset
sodium acid pyrophosphate.why_avoid: Synthetic chemical additive with limited long-term studies

sodium aluminum phosphate.name: Sodium Aluminum Phosphate
sodium aluminum phosphate.why_avoid: Source of aluminum which may accumulate in brain tissue

sodium aluminum sulfate.name: Sodium Aluminum Sulfate
sodium aluminum sulfate.why_avoid: Contains aluminum which may be neurotoxic

sodium benzoate.name: Sodium Benzoate
sodium benzoate.health_effects: May form benzene (a carcinogen) when combined with vitamin C
sodium benzoate.why_avoid: Potential to form harmful compounds under certain conditions

sodium bisulfite.name: Sodium Bisulfite
sodium bisulfite.health_effects: May cause allergic reactions and asthma attacks
sodium bisulfite.why_avoid: Can trigger severe allergic responses in sensitive individuals

sodium caseinate.name: Sodium Caseinate
sodium caseinate.description: Milk protein derivative used as emulsifier
sodium caseinate.health_effects: May cause allergic reactions in milk-sensitive individuals
sodium caseinate.why_avoid: Hidden dairy ingredient that can trigger allergies

sodium diacetate.name: Sodium Diacetate
sodium diacetate.health_effects: May cause digestive irritation in sensitive individuals
sodium diacetate.why_avoid: Synthetic additive with potential gastrointestinal effects

sodium erythorbate.name: Sodium Erythorbate
sodium erythorbate.health_effects: May cause allergic reactions and kidney stones
sodium erythorbate.why_avoid: Synthetic chemical with potential adverse effects

sodium hexametaphosphate.name: Sodium Hexametaphosphate
sodium hexametaphosphate.description: Chemical used as emulsifier and sequestrant
sodium hexametaphosphate.health_effects: May cause digestive upset and mineral imbalances

sodium metabisulfite.name: Sodium Metabisulfite
sodium metabisulfite.health_effects: May cause severe allergic reactions and asthma
sodium metabisulfite.why_avoid: Can trigger life-threatening reactions in sensitive individuals

sodium nitrate.name: Sodium Nitrate
sodium nitrate.description: Chemical preservative used in cured meats
sodium nitrate.health_effects: Converts to nitrites, forms carcinogenic nitrosamines

sodium nitrite.name: Sodium Nitrite
sodium nitrite.description: Chemical preservative that maintains meat color
sodium nitrite.why_avoid: Combines with amines to form cancer-causing compounds

sodium phosphate.name: Sodium Phosphate
sodium phosphate.description: Chemical additive used as emulsifier and pH adjuster
sodium phosphate.health_effects: May cause digestive issues and mineral imbalances
sodium phosphate.why_avoid: Can interfere with calcium and other mineral absorption

sodium sulfite.name: Sodium Sulfite
sodium sulfite.health_effects: May cause allergic reactions and asthma attacks
sodium sulfite.why_avoid: Can trigger severe respiratory reactions in sensitive people

sorbic acid.name: Sorbic Acid
sorbic acid.description: Chemical preservative to prevent mold growth
sorbic acid.health_effects: May cause skin and respiratory irritation
sorbic acid.why_avoid: Can trigger allergic reactions in sensitive individuals

sorbitol.name: Sorbitol
sorbitol.description: Sugar alcohol used as sweetener and humectant
sorbitol.health_effects: May cause digestive upset, diarrhea, and gas

soybean oil.name: Soybean Oil
soybean oil.health_effects: High in omega-6 fats, may promote inflammation
soybean oil.why_avoid: Highly processed and often from GMO soybeans

soy lecithin.name: Soy Lecithin
soy lecithin.health_effects: Generally safe but may cause digestive issues in some people
soy lecithin.why_avoid: Often made from genetically modified soybeans

splenda.name: Splenda (Sucralose)
splenda.description: Brand name for sucralose artificial sweetener
splenda.health_effects: May disrupt gut bacteria and glucose metabolism
splenda.why_avoid: Synthetic sweetener with potential metabolic effects

stevioside.name: Stevioside
stevioside.description: Natural sweetener compound from stevia plant
stevioside.health_effects: Generally safe but highly processed commercial forms may contain additives
stevioside.why_avoid: Commercial stevia products often contain other additives

sucralose.name: Sucralose
sucralose.description: Artificial sweetener made by chlorinating sugar
sucralose.health_effects: May disrupt gut bacteria and affect glucose metabolism
sucralose.why_avoid: Synthetic chlorinated compound with unknown long-term effects

sulfur dioxide.name: Sulfur Dioxide
sulfur dioxide.health_effects: May cause allergic reactions and asthma attacks

sulfuric acid.name: Sulfuric Acid
sulfuric acid.description: Strong acid used in food processing
sulfuric acid.health_effects: Highly corrosive, can cause severe burns and respiratory damage

sunflower oil.name: Sunflower Oil
sunflower oil.description: Oil extracted from sunflower seeds, often highly processed
sunflower oil.health_effects: Very high in omega-6 fatty acids, promotes inflammation
sunflower oil.why_avoid: Extremely high omega-6 content contributes to inflammatory conditions

sunset yellow.name: Sunset Yellow
sunset yellow.health_effects: May cause hyperactivity and allergic reactions
sunset yellow.why_avoid: Artificial dye linked to behavioral problems in children

sweet n low.name: Sweet'N Low (Saccharin)
sweet n low.description: Brand name for saccharin artificial sweetener
sweet n low.why_avoid: Animal studies showed increased cancer risk

symphytine.name: Symphytine
symphytine.why_avoid: Toxic alkaloid causing liver damage and cancer

tartrazine.name: Tartrazine (Yellow #5)
tartrazine.health_effects: May cause hyperactivity, allergic reactions, and asthma
tartrazine.why_avoid: Linked to behavioral problems and allergic responses

tbhq.name: TBHQ (Tertiary-Butylhydroquinone)
tbhq.health_effects: May cause nausea, vomiting, and potential carcinogenic effects
tbhq.why_avoid: Petroleum derivative with concerning toxicity studies

tertiary-butylhydroquinone.name: Tertiary-Butylhydroquinone
tertiary-butylhydroquinone.description: Synthetic antioxidant preservative derived from petroleum
tertiary-butylhydroquinone.health_effects: May cause stomach tumors and DNA damage
tertiary-butylhydroquinone.why_avoid: Industrial chemical with potential carcinogenic properties

titanium dioxide.name: Titanium Dioxide
titanium dioxide.description: White pigment used to brighten and whiten foods
titanium dioxide.health_effects: May cause inflammatory and immune responses
titanium dioxide.why_avoid: Potential carcinogen when inhaled, immune system effects

trans fat.name: Trans Fat
trans fat.health_effects: Increases heart disease risk, inflammation, and bad cholesterol
trans fat.why_avoid: No safe level of consumption, banned in many countries

trp-p-1.name: Trp-P-1
trp-p-1.description: Heterocyclic amine formed during protein pyrolysis
trp-p-1.why_avoid: Potent mutagen formed during high-temperature cooking

vegetable oil.name: Vegetable Oil
vegetable oil.description: Generic term for highly processed plant oils
vegetable oil.health_effects: Usually high in inflammatory omega-6 fatty acids
vegetable oil.why_avoid: Vague labeling often hides less desirable oils

vinyl chloride.name: Vinyl Chloride
vinyl chloride.description: Chemical that can migrate from PVC packaging
vinyl chloride.why_avoid: Potent carcinogen that can contaminate packaged foods

white mineral oil.name: White Mineral Oil
white mineral oil.description: Petroleum-derived oil used as food additive
white mineral oil.why_avoid: Petroleum product that can block nutrient absorption

xanthan gum.name: Xanthan Gum
xanthan gum.health_effects: May cause digestive upset and allergic reactions
xanthan gum.why_avoid: Can cause gastrointestinal distress in sensitive individuals

xylitol.name: Xylitol
xylitol.health_effects: May cause digestive upset, extremely toxic to dogs

yellow #5.name: Yellow #5 (Tartrazine)
yellow #5.health_effects: May cause hyperactivity, allergic reactions, and asthma
yellow #5.why_avoid: Linked to behavioral problems and requires warning labels in Europe

yellow #6.name: Yellow #6 (Sunset Yellow)
yellow #6.health_effects: May cause hyperactivity and allergic reactions
yellow #6.why_avoid: Made from petroleum derivatives, linked to behavioral issues

yellow 5.name: Yellow 5
yellow 5.health_effects: May cause hyperactivity and allergic reactions
yellow 5.why_avoid: Artificial dye with behavioral and allergenic effects

yellow.name: Yellow (Food Coloring)
yellow.health_effects: May cause hyperactivity and allergic reactions
yellow.why_avoid: Artificial dyes linked to behavioral problems

zearalenone.name: Zearalenone
zearalenone.description: Mycotoxin with estrogenic effects produced by Fusarium
zearalenone.why_avoid: Potent estrogen-like compound from mold contamination

psoralen.name: Psoralen
psoralen.description: Naturally occurring phototoxic compound found in some plants
psoralen.health_effects: Phototoxic reactions, skin sensitivity to UV light
psoralen.why_avoid: Can cause severe skin reactions when exposed to sunlight

pulegone.name: Pulegone
pulegone.description: Natural compound found in mint plants
pulegone.health_effects: Potential liver toxicity at high doses
pulegone.why_avoid: May cause liver damage with excessive consumption

pyrrolizidine.name: Pyrrolizidine Alkaloids
pyrrolizidine.description: Group of toxic compounds found in certain plants
pyrrolizidine.why_avoid: Highly toxic to the liver even in small amounts

quercetin.name: Quercetin
quercetin.description: Natural plant flavonoid with antioxidant properties
quercetin.health_effects: Generally beneficial but may interact with some medications
quercetin.why_avoid: Potential drug interactions in high doses

ractopamine.name: Ractopamine
ractopamine.description: Growth promoter used in livestock production
ractopamine.health_effects: Potential cardiovascular effects, banned in many countries
ractopamine.why_avoid: Not approved for use in human food in many countries

rbgh.name: rBGH (Recombinant Bovine Growth Hormone)
rbgh.description: Synthetic growth hormone used in dairy cows
rbgh.health_effects: Potential increased IGF-1 levels, possible cancer link
rbgh.why_avoid: Banned in many countries due to health concerns

recombinant bovine growth hormone.name: Recombinant Bovine Growth Hormone
recombinant bovine growth hormone.description: Genetically engineered hormone to increase milk production
recombinant bovine growth hormone.health_effects: May increase levels of growth factors in milk
recombinant bovine growth hormone.why_avoid: Controversial due to potential health impacts

red #2.name: Red #2 (Amaranth)
red #2.health_effects: Banned in US due to cancer concerns
red #2.why_avoid: Shown to cause cancer in animal studies

red 2.name: Red 2
red 2.why_avoid: Banned in many countries due to safety concerns

retrorsine d.name: Retrorsine
retrorsine d.why_avoid: Highly toxic plant compound causing liver damage

rice bran oil.name: Rice Bran Oil
rice bran oil.health_effects: May contain traces of arsenic from rice

saccharin.name: Saccharin
saccharin.health_effects: Potential carcinogen in high doses, bitter aftertaste
saccharin.why_avoid: Older artificial sweetener with safety concerns

safflower.name: Safflower
safflower.health_effects: High omega-6 content may promote inflammation
safflower.why_avoid: Highly processed form may be inflammatory

senkirkine d.name: Senkirkine
senkirkine d.why_avoid: Potent liver toxin found in some herbs

sesame oil.name: Sesame Oil
sesame oil.why_avoid: May be inflammatory in large amounts

sodium bisulfate.name: Sodium Bisulfate
sodium bisulfate.why_avoid: Strong acid that can irritate digestive tract

sodium carboxymethyl cellulose.name: Sodium Carboxymethyl Cellulose
sodium carboxymethyl cellulose.why_avoid: Artificial additive that may affect gut health

sodium nitrites.name: Sodium Nitrites
sodium nitrites.description: Meat preservatives that maintain pink color

sodium saccharin d.name: Sodium Saccharin
sodium saccharin d.description: Salt form of artificial sweetener saccharin

styrene.name: Styrene
styrene.description: Chemical that can migrate from polystyrene packaging
styrene.why_avoid: Can leach from plastic containers into food

sugartwin.name: SugarTwin (Saccharin)
sugartwin.description: Brand name for saccharin artificial sweetener

sunflower.name: Sunflower
sunflower.health_effects: High omega-6 content may promote inflammation
sunflower.why_avoid: Highly processed form may be inflammatory

symphytine d.name: Symphytine
symphytine d.why_avoid: Potent liver toxin found in comfrey

tcdd.name: TCDD (2,3,7,8-Tetrachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin)
tcdd.why_avoid: One of the most toxic chemicals known

trans,trans-2,4-hexadienal.name: trans,trans-2,4-Hexadienal
trans,trans-2,4-hexadienal.why_avoid: Indicates rancidity in oils and fats

trichloroethylene.name: Trichloroethylene
trichloroethylene.description: Industrial solvent that can contaminate foods
trichloroethylene.why_avoid: Industrial chemical with serious health risks

urethane.name: Urethane
urethane.description: Chemical that can form during fermentation
urethane.why_avoid: Forms naturally in some fermented foods

vanillin.name: Vanillin
vanillin.health_effects: Generally safe but synthetic forms may contain impurities
vanillin.why_avoid: Artificial versions may contain unwanted chemicals

yeast extract.name: Yeast Extract
yeast extract.health_effects: May cause reactions in MSG-sensitive individuals
yeast extract.why_avoid: Contains free glutamates similar to MSG

α,β-aldehydes.name: α,β-Aldehydes
α,β-aldehydes.description: Oxidation products of unsaturated fatty acids
α,β-aldehydes.why_avoid: Indicators of rancidity and oxidative damage

β-myrcene.name: β-Myrcene
β-myrcene.health_effects: Generally safe but may have sedative effects
β-myrcene.why_avoid: Potential drug interactions in high doses
